SEARCH

Class Pet

java.lang.Object
Pet
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Pet extends Object implements Serializable
The main class that stores the attributes of a single pet. There will probably be one of these per save file.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Pet

      public Pet(String name, String type, Inventory inventory, Gacha gacha)
      Creates a new pet, probably called once per save file.

      This pet starts with a default value of 75/100 points for all stats (feel free to change). The pet's stats are: health, energy, fullness, happiness, hydration, intelligence. There is also a stat for score (as per the functional requirements) and evoLevel.

      You should call methods in this class depending on player interaction.

      The default max values for all stats are 100. You can change this using the setMax methods.

      Please read the method descriptions for more information.

      Parameters:
      name - - The name given to the pet (e.g. Fido)
      type - - The pet type (e.g. Dog)
      inventory - - The inventory that this pet uses. Create a new inventory class and pass it here.
      gacha - - The gacha system that this pet uses. Create a new gacha class and pass it here.

  • Method Details

    • incrementHealth

      public void incrementHealth(int amount)
      Increases the pet's health by the specified amount. Can be negative to decrease health. The pet's stat will remain between 0 and 100.
      Parameters:
      amount - - The amount to increase the health by

    • incrementEnergy

      public void incrementEnergy(int amount)
      Increases the pet's energy by the specified amount. Can be negative to decrease energy. The pet's stat will remain between 0 and 100.
      Parameters:
      amount - - The amount to increase the energy by

    • incrementFullness

      public void incrementFullness(int amount)
      Increases the pet's fullness by the specified amount. Can be negative to decrease fullness. The pet's stat will remain between 0 and 100.
      Parameters:
      amount - - The amount to increase the fullness by

    • incrementHappiness

      public void incrementHappiness(int amount)
      Increases the pet's happiness by the specified amount. Can be negative to decrease happiness. The pet's stat will remain between 0 and 100.
      Parameters:
      amount - - The amount to increase the happiness by

    • incrementScore

      public void incrementScore(int amount)
      Increases the pet's score by the specified amount. Can be negative to decrease score. No need to call this method for stat increases (already done in this class). The pet's score will remain at a minimum of 0.
      Parameters:
      amount - - The amount to increase the score by

    • incrementCoins

      public void incrementCoins(int amount)
      Increases the pet's coins by the specified amount. Can be negative to decrease coins. The pet's coins will remain at a minimum of 0.
      Parameters:
      amount - - The amount to increase the coins by

    • decrementAllStats

      public void decrementAllStats(int amount)
      Decrements all stats besides health by 1.
      Parameters:
      amount - the value to decrease stats by. Should be positive.

    • setMaxHealth

      public void setMaxHealth(int maxHealth)
      Sets the pet's health to the specified amount.
      Parameters:

    • isDead

      public boolean isDead()
      Returns if the pet is dead. If the pet died, the game should be over. The player should not be able to do anything in this save file anymore unless the pet is revived via parental controls.
      Returns:
      true if the pet is dead, false otherwise

    • isSleeping

      public boolean isSleeping()
      Returns if the pet is sleeping. If the pet is sleeping, there should be a health penalty. No player interaction can be done until the pet wakes up, where the energy level will return to 100.
      Returns:
      true if the pet is sleeping, false otherwise

    • isSleepy

      public boolean isSleepy()

    • isSick

      public boolean isSick()

    • isHungry

      public boolean isHungry()
      Returns if the pet is hungry. If the pet is hungry, their happiness and health should decrease faster over time.
      Returns:
      true if the pet is hungry, false otherwise

    • isAngry

      public boolean isAngry()
      Returns if the pet is angry. If the pet is angry, they should refuse all commands that don't increase happiness. The pet remains in this state until their happiness reaches at least 50.
      Returns:
      true if the pet is angry, false otherwise

    • isStillAngry

      public boolean isStillAngry()
      Should only be called if the pet is in the angry state. If the pet is not longer angry, return true.
      Returns:
      true if the pet has recovered from the angry state, false otherwise.

    • isStillSleeping

      public boolean isStillSleeping()

    • setSleepingState

      public void setSleepingState(boolean state)

    • isNormal

      public boolean isNormal()
      Checks all negative states. If none of them are true, then the pet is normal.
      Returns:
      true if the pet is normal, false otherwise

    • addNewItemToInventory

      public void addNewItemToInventory(Item item)
      Adds an item to the pet's inventory. This method takes an item object, and should only be called once per object type.
      Parameters:
      item - - The item to add to the inventory
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an item with the same name already exists in the inventory
      See Also:
      • Inventory.addNewItem(Item)

    • updateItemQuantity

      public void updateItemQuantity(String itemName, int value)
      Increases or decreases the quantity of an item in the pet's inventory. Used when the player gains or uses an item.
      Parameters:
      itemName - - The name of the item to update
      value - - The value to add to the current quantity. Can be positive or negative.
      See Also:
      • Inventory.updateItemQuantity(String, int)

    • giveItem

      public Item giveItem(String itemName)
      Gives an item to the pet from the inventory. If the item's quantity is zero, return null. If the item does not exist, throws an exception.

      When an item is used, the item's quantity should decrease by 1. The corresponding stat will increase based on the value specified in the item class. If it is a food, fullness will increase. If it is a gift, happiness will increase.

      Parameters:
      itemName - - The name of the item to give
      Returns:
      the item if its quantity is greater than 0, or null if the item's quantity is 0
      See Also:
      • Inventory.useItem(String)

    • evolve

      public void evolve()
      Increases the evolution level by 1. Should be used with a condition in the front-end (e.g. if score is greater than a certain amount).
